data.enText: spread
spread
open/arrange
to open sth that has been folded so that it covers a larger area than before
to spread a cloth on a table
Sue spread the map out on the floor.
The bird spread its wings.
to arrange objects so that they cover a large area and can be seen easily
Papers had been spread out on the desk.
arms/legs
to move your arms, legs, fingers, etc. far apart from each other

data.chText: 她张开双臂，孩子向她跑来。
data.enText: She spread her arms and the child ran towards her.
among people
to affect or make sth affect, be known by, or used by more and more people
The disease spreads easily.

data.chText: 短短几个星期，他的信心感染了全体队员。
data.enText: Within weeks, his confidence had spread throughout the team.

data.chText: 在那个时期，计算机的应用迅速流传开来。
data.enText: Use of computers spread rapidly during that period.

data.chText: 散布关于某人的谣言 / 谎言
data.enText: to spread rumours/lies about sb

data.chText: 这种疾病通过蚊子传播。
data.enText: The disease is spread by mosquitoes.
cover large area
to cover, or to make sth cover, a larger and larger area

data.chText: 大火迅速蔓延到了邻近的建筑物。
data.enText: The fire rapidly spread to adjoining buildings.
Water began to spread across the floor.

data.chText: 微笑慢慢在她脸上绽开。
data.enText: A smile spread slowly across her face.

data.chText: 用水太多可能使污迹扩散。
data.enText: Using too much water could spread the stain.
to cause sb/sth to be in a number of different places

data.chText: 种子和花粉是随风传播的。
data.enText: Seeds and pollen are spread by the wind.

data.chText: 我们有1万名成员分布在全国各地。
data.enText: We have 10 000 members spread all over the country.
to cover a large area
The valley spread out beneath us.
soft layer
to put a layer of a substance onto the surface of sth; to be able to be put onto a surface
to spread butter on pieces of toast
pieces of toast spread with butter

data.chText: 油漆如果太稠就涂不均匀。
data.enText: If the paint is too thick, it will not spread evenly.
divide/share

data.chText: 分（若干次）进行；由（若干人）分摊
data.enText: to separate sth into parts and divide them between different times or different people

data.chText: 一共五次面谈，分两天进行。
data.enText: A series of five interviews will be spread over two days.

data.chText: 你为什么不把汽车保险费按月分期支付呢？
data.enText: Why not pay monthly and spread the cost of your car insurance?

data.chText: 我们试图把工作分摊给各部门。
data.enText: We attempted to spread the workload between the departments.
spread like wildfire

data.chText: 像野火般蔓延；迅速传开
data.enText: to become known by more and more people very quickly
spread your net

data.chText: 考虑到多种可能；大面积地排查；撒开网（寻找）
data.enText: to consider a wide range of possibilities or cover a large area, especially to try to find sb/sth

data.chText: 他们撒开网四处物色新的运动队教练。
data.enText: They have spread their net far and wide in the search for a new team coach.
spread your wings

data.chText: 展翅高飞（更自信地尝试新事物）
data.enText: to become more independent and confident and try new activities, etc.
spread the word
to tell people about sth
spread yourself too thin

data.chText: 样样都抓哪样都抓不好
data.enText: to try to do so many different things at the same time that you do not do any of them well
spread out
spread yourself out
to stretch your body or arrange your things over a large area

data.chText: 头等舱宽敞些，伸得开腿。
data.enText: There's more room to spread out in first class.

data.chText: 你就非得躺下，把整个沙发全占了才行吗？
data.enText: Do you have to spread yourself out all over the sofa?
to separate from other people in a group, to cover a larger area

data.chText: 搜索人员分散开来，好更快地搜索这一地区。
data.enText: The searchers spread out to cover the area faster.
increase
an increase in the amount or number of sth that there is, or in the area that is affected by sth
to prevent the spread of disease
to encourage the spread of information

data.chText: 城市向周边地区的扩展
data.enText: the spread of a city into the surrounding areas
range/variety
a range or variety of people or things
a broad spread of opinions
on bread
a soft food that you put on bread

data.chText: 不要抹黄油，抹点低脂肪的东西吧。
data.enText: Use a low-fat spread instead of butter.
cheese spread
area covered
the area that sth exists in or happens in

data.chText: 该公司在这个国家开设的饭店地理分布相当广。
data.enText: The company has a good geographical spread of hotels in this country.
how wide sth is or the area that sth covers
The bird's wings have a spread of nearly a metre.
in newspaper/magazine
an article or advertisement in a newspaper or magazine, especially one that covers two opposite pages

data.chText: 这篇报道在报纸的内页有横贯两版的后续部分。
data.enText: The story continued with a double-page spread on the inside pages.
meal
a large meal, especially one that is prepared for a special occasion

data.chText: 他们为聚会安排了丰盛的食物。
data.enText: They had laid on a huge spread for the party.
of land/water
an area of land or water
a vast spread of water

data.chText: 他们在加利福尼亚拥有大片的土地。
data.enText: They have a huge spread in California (= a large farm or ranch ) .
finance

data.chText: （两种价格或比率的）差额，差幅
data.enText: the difference between two rates or prices
on bed

ex.zh: 迅速摊开（或涂抹、传播、蔓延）
快速摊开（或涂抹、传播、蔓延）
到处摊开（或涂抹、传播、蔓延）
均匀摊开；均匀涂抹；均匀扩散；平均分期；平均分摊
预防/阻止某事物的传播（或蔓延）

data.enText: spread like wildfire

data.chText: 像野火般蔓延；迅速传开
data.enText: to become known by more and more people very quickly
spread your net

data.chText: 考虑到多种可能；大面积地排查；撒开网（寻找）
data.enText: to consider a wide range of possibilities or cover a large area, especially to try to find sb/sth

data.chText: 他们撒开网四处物色新的运动队教练。
data.enText: They have spread their net far and wide in the search for a new team coach.
spread your wings

data.chText: 展翅高飞（更自信地尝试新事物）
data.enText: to become more independent and confident and try new activities, etc.
spread the word
to tell people about sth
spread yourself too thin

data.chText: 样样都抓哪样都抓不好
data.enText: to try to do so many different things at the same time that you do not do any of them well
spread out
spread yourself out
to stretch your body or arrange your things over a large area

data.chText: 头等舱宽敞些，伸得开腿。
data.enText: There's more room to spread out in first class.

data.chText: 你就非得躺下，把整个沙发全占了才行吗？
data.enText: Do you have to spread yourself out all over the sofa?
to separate from other people in a group, to cover a larger area

data.chText: 搜索人员分散开来，好更快地搜索这一地区。
data.enText: The searchers spread out to cover the area faster.

trans: 伸出，张开，叉开（手臂、双手、双腿等）

tr: act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time
decorative cover for a bed
farm consisting of a large tract of land along with facilities needed to raise livestock (especially cattle)
a conspicuous disparity or difference as between two figures
example: the spread between lending and borrowing costs

tr: a haphazard distribution in all directions
the expansion of a person's girth (especially at middle age)
example: she exercised to avoid that middle-aged spread

tr: two facing pages of a book or other publication
process or result of distributing or extending over a wide expanse of space
a meal that is well prepared and greatly enjoyed
example: a banquet for the graduating seniors
they put out quite a spread

tr: a tasty mixture to be spread on bread or crackers or used in preparing other dishes
cause to become widely known
become widely known and passed on
example: the story went around in the office

tr: distribute or disperse widely
example: The invaders spread their language all over the country

tr: become distributed or widespread
spread out or open from a closed or folded state
distribute over a surface in a layer
example: spread cheese on a piece of bread

tr: cover by spreading something over
move outward
strew or distribute over an area
example: He spread fertilizer over the lawn

tr: spread across or over
example: A big oil spot spread across the water

tr: distributed or spread over a considerable extent
example: has ties with many widely dispersed friends
eleven million Jews are spread throughout Europe

tr: fully extended in width
prepared or arranged for a meal
especially having food set out

value.def: If you spread something somewhere, you open it out or arrange it over a place or surface, so that all of it can be seen or used easily.

example.ex: She spread a towel on the sand and lay on it...
example.tran: 她在沙滩上铺了一条毛巾，躺在上面。

example.ex: His coat was spread over the bed.
example.tran: 他的外套摊在床上。

example.ex: He extracted several glossy prints and spread them out on a low coffee table...
example.tran: 他掏出几张光面照片，将它们摆在一张矮茶几上。

example.ex: In his room, Tom was spreading out a map of Scandinavia on the bed.
example.tran: 房间里，汤姆正将一张斯堪的纳维亚地图在床上铺开。

value.def: If you spread your arms, hands, fingers, or legs, you stretch them out until they are far apart.

example.ex: Sitting on the floor, spread your legs as far as they will go without overstretching...
example.tran: 坐在地板上，在不要拉伤的前提下将双腿尽量分开。

example.ex: He stepped back and spread his hands wide. 'You are most welcome to our home.'
example.tran: 他往后退了一步，伸开双手。“非常欢迎你到我们家来。”

example.ex: David made a gesture, spreading out his hands as if he were showing that he had no explanation to make...
example.tran: 戴维做了个手势，摊开双手，好像在说他没有什么可解释的。

example.ex: You need a bed that's large enough to let you spread yourself out.
example.tran: 你需要一张能让自己舒展四肢躺着的大床。

value.tran: 伸出，张开,叉开(手臂、双手、手指、双腿等)

value.def: If you spread a substance on a surface or spread the surface with the substance, you put a thin layer of the substance over the surface.

example.ex: Spread the mixture in the cake tin and bake for 30 minutes...
example.tran: 将混合物抹在蛋糕烤盘里，烘烤 30 分钟。

example.ex: A thick layer of wax was spread over the surface...
example.tran: 表面涂上了厚厚的一层蜡。

example.ex: Spread the bread with the cheese.
example.tran: 在面包上抹奶酪。

value.def: Spread is a soft food which is put on bread.

example.ex: ...a wholemeal salad roll with low fat spread.
example.tran: 涂有低脂酱的全麦色拉面包卷

value.def: If something spreads or is spread by people, it gradually reaches or affects a larger and larger area or more and more people.

example.ex: The industrial revolution which started a couple of hundred years ago in Europe is now spreading across the world.
example.tran: 两百多年前始于欧洲的工业革命目前正在向全世界传播。

example.ex: ...the sense of fear spreading in residential neighborhoods...
example.tran: 在住宅小区中蔓延的恐惧感

example.ex: He was fed-up with the lies being spread about him.
example.tran: 关于自己的流言蜚语满天乱飞，他实在受够了。

example.ex: The greatest hope for reform is the gradual spread of information...
example.tran: 对改革的最大希望是信息能得以逐渐传播。

example.ex: Thanks to the spread of modern technology, trained workers are now more vital than ever.
example.tran: 由于现代技术的普及，现在受过培训的工人的作用比以往任何时候都更为重要。

value.def: If something such as a liquid, gas, or smoke spreads or is spread, it moves outwards in all directions so that it covers a larger area.

example.ex: Fire spread rapidly after a chemical truck exploded...
example.tran: 一辆装有化学品的卡车爆炸后，火势迅速蔓延。

example.ex: A dark red stain was spreading across his shirt...
example.tran: 一块深红色的污渍正在他的衬衫上渗开。

example.ex: In Northern California, a wildfire has spread a haze of smoke over 200 miles.
example.tran: 在加利福尼亚州北部，一场野火产生的烟雾已扩散了 200 多英里。

example.ex: The situation was complicated by the spread of a serious forest fire.
example.tran: 一场严重的森林大火的蔓延使得形势更加复杂。

value.def: If you spread something over a period of time, it takes place regularly or continuously over that period, rather than happening at one time.

example.ex: There seems to be little difference whether you eat all your calorie allowance in one go, or spread it over the day...
example.tran: 不管你是一次性摄入全天的卡路里限量，还是在一天内分次摄入，结果好像没有多大差别。

example.ex: The course is spread over a five week period.
example.tran: 这门课将持续 5 周时间。

value.tran: 将…分散(在一段时间内);分期做

value.def: If you spread something such as wealth or work, you distribute it evenly or equally.

example.ex: ...policies that spread the state's wealth more evenly...
example.tran: 更加平均地分配国家财富的政策

example.ex: The loss of jobs has been far more evenly spread across the regions than it was during the early 1980s.
example.tran: 失业数字在各地区之间的分布要比 20 世纪 80 年代初均衡多了。

example.ex: There are easier ways to encourage the even spread of wealth.
example.tran: 有一些更简单的方法可以促进财富的平均分配。

value.def: A spread of ideas, interests, or other things is a wide variety of them.

example.ex: A topic-based approach can be hard to assess in primary schools with a typical spread of ability...
example.tran: 因为学生的能力通常差异很大，基于话题的教学方法在小学里评估起来可能很难。

example.ex: We have an enormous spread of industries, mainly in the Home Counties and East Anglia.
example.tran: 我们拥有种类繁多的工业，主要位于伦敦周围各郡和东英吉利地区。

value.def: A spread is a large meal, especially one that has been prepared for a special occasion.
value.tran: (尤指为某一特殊场合准备的)丰盛饭菜，盛宴

value.def: A spread is two pages of a book, magazine, or newspaper that are opposite each other when you open it at a particular place.

example.ex: There was a double-page spread of a dinner for 46 people.
example.tran: 有一张横贯两版的、由 46 人参加的宴席的照片。

value.tran: (书籍、杂志、报纸中)横贯两版的篇幅

value.def: Spread is used to refer to the difference between the price that a seller wants someone to pay for a particular stock or share and the price that the buyer is willing to pay.

example.ex: Market makers earn their livings from the spread between buying and selling prices.
example.tran: 做市商靠赚取买卖价差生存。

trans: 频展；展频；扩展频谱；扩频技术；展频技术
